system.biography:
TitleFFF 403-1 Cartographer
Birthday12 Ilvin 689
AppearanceAge 30, height 6’0”, light frame, weight 153 lb, average appearance, medium complexion, brown hair, green eyes
Medical/PsycheNone
Size6
ArmorGood quality cloth robe, felt hat, leather belt and shoes, and dagger. Add short bow and quiver (20 arrows) if he has time to prepare.
Other EquipmentBelt pouch, tinder box, looking glass
Valuables37d in coin
Notes

Biography

Lander is the bastard son of a Halean solithar (temple guard) and a lonely but wealthy young widow. He never knew his father. His mother moved to Thay before he was born and always claimed that her husband died after she got pregnant. She had enough money to buy a house and hire a tutor for Lander. However, the money had run out by the time he reached adulthood. His mother donated her house to the Halean church in return for them taking care of her.

With no inheritance to speak of, Lander’s only asset was his skill with reading and writing. Over the last few years, he has travelled around Hârn, at first as a scribe for hire. During his travels, he took notes of the places he visited, the rivers he crossed, and how long it took to get from place to place. When people discovered he was well travelled, they started to ask him for detailed directions. Lander realized there was money to be made and began to make maps of the main trade routes. They became his trademark, although he still worked as a scribe to make extra money.

Lander is known for his scroll maps. These are long, narrow documents with a major city at the top and bottom and a straight line between. Along the line, Lander describes river crossings, towns, villages, and hazards. He also notes crossroads and which way to turn, although the route on the map itself is always straight. He is always looking for new routes or to update the maps of his old ones. He has several good customers, mostly mercantylers. Every other year, Lander takes a long trip to gather details for a new map. He has 16 different maps for sale.

Adventure Hooks

I Need To Go To… Lander has a gap in his collection, a route he has not travelled. He cannot find anyone travelling that way, so he has decided to hire his own guards and guides. He has no wilderness skills but is an experienced traveller.

Lies, All Lies. The PCs buy a map from Lander. It is completely wrong and it is obvious the mapmaker has never actually travelled anywhere. When they return to complain, Lander hires the Lia-Kavair to ensure their “lies” don’t spread.

I Can Show You the Way. The PCs need to travel somewhere they have never been. Lander doesn’t have a map to the place but he has been there before and offers to guide them for a fee. The problem is that it has been many years since he was there. He gets the party completely lost.

Credits

This character is taken from “Friends, Foes, and Followers, Vol. 1” on Lythia.com (https://www.lythia.com/game_aides/friends-foes-followers-volume-1/), by Kerry Mould, with illustrations by Richard Luscheck and Juha Makkonen, and is “fanon”, a derivative work of copyrighted material by Columbia Games Inc. and N. Robin Crossby.
